markdown:
Skip to main content 

###### Menu

____ Show/hide collapsed content

SkilledTradesBC is the Provincial Government organization that oversees the trades training and certification process in British Columbia (B.C.). We provide support on the following topics:

  * [Apprenticeship registration and completion](/become-an-apprentice) in B.C. for newly landed immigrants 

  * Experienced tradespersons who want to [get certified](/challenge-certification-exam) in B.C. (also known as Trade Qualifiers)

  * [Study and exam resources](/get-certified-about-exams/exam-study-support) available for Trade Qualifiers




**Please note that we do not provide support for any immigration, visa or job search-related queries. If you are a skilled worker from outside of Canada who wants to come and work in B.C., visit**[**Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)**](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html) **and**[**WelcomeBC**](https://www.welcomebc.ca/)**to find out more information.******

**See below for Frequently Asked Questions and resource links.**

## 

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I become an apprentice? 

To become an apprentice in a skilled trade, you will need to be legally able to work and attend school in Canada. Follow the steps on the [Become an Apprentice page](/become-an-apprentice) to learn more or the [Find Your Trade page](/find-your-trade) to explore the different trade programs in B.C. 

If you have questions about student or work visas, please contact [Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html).

[Contact IRCC](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html)

Can I use my trades experience to apply for Permanent Residency?

The B.C. government has implemented the B.C. Provincial Nominee Program (BC PNP) to offer qualified and experienced skilled trades workers a pathway to permanently settle in the province. Please visit [WelcomeBC ](https://www.welcomebc.ca/)or [Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html) for further information or queries. 

SkilledTradesBC do not offer advice or support for any questions related to BC PNP.

Where do I find a job in the skilled trades? 

If you are new to Canada and are legally able to work in Canada, there are newcomer organizations that may provide job search supports and other services. Contact the service organization closest to you using [the search tool on this page. ](https://ircc.canada.ca/english/newcomers/services/index.asp)

You can also search job postings through these agencies:

  * [WorkBC](https://www.workbc.ca/)

  * [STEP](https://www.stepbc.ca/)

  * [SUCCESS](https://successbc.ca/)

  * [MOSAIC](https://mosaicbc.org/)

  * [ISS of BC](https://issbc.org/)

  * [PICS Society](https://pics.bc.ca/)




If you do not yet have permission to work in Canada, visit [Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html) and [WelcomeBC](https://www.welcomebc.ca/) for more information on application and eligibility requirements.

I am certified in a trade in another country. How do I find the equivalent trade in B.C.?

Visit the [Find Your Trade page](/find-your-trade) to search for your trade. The Record Books and the Challenge a Trade section on each trade page may help you determine what is required to become certified in that trade. 

How do I apply for a visa to enter Canada to write my exam?

SkilledTradesBC does not have authority over visa applications or immigration. Please visit the [Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html) website for information on visas. 

[Contact IRCC](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html)

Where do I find study resources to help me write my skilled trades Level or Trade Qualifier exams?

[Visit this page on Exam and Study Support](/get-certified-about-exams/exam-study-support) for resources including videos, websites, refresher courses, and more.

I am not fluent in the English language. What are my options to write my exam in another language?

You may apply to use a Translator/Interpreter, a translation dictionary, or request a French version of your Interprovincial Red Seal exam. For more information, [visit this page on Exam Accommodations](/exam-accommodations).

Do I need to show my IELTS/CELPIP (English Language) exam results to become an apprentice or write an exam with SkilledTradesBC?

No, this is not required to become a skilled trade apprentice or to write an exam with us. 

However, trades schools may require IELTS/CELPIP exam results to register for school. 

How long will it take to get my Trade Qualifier application approved? 

Currently, it takes 8 to 10 weeks for an application to get reviewed and processed. 

I have experience in a trade, how do I get my qualifications recognized in BC?

You may be eligible to write the certification exam and receive full certification through the challenge process. Follow the steps on the [Challenge a Certification Exam page](/challenge-certification-exam) to get started.

## 

Resources

Find free newcomer services near you: <https://ircc.canada.ca/english/newcomers/services/index.asp>

Government of Canada’s Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada: <https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship.html>

Learn about B.C. Provincial Nominee Program (BC PNP) information: [https://www.welcomebc.ca](https://www.welcomebc.ca)

WelcomeBC’s list of settlement service providers: <https://www.welcomebc.ca/Start-Your-Life-in-B-C/documents/BCSIS-Service-Provider-Organizations.aspx>

Contact Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada: <https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/contact-ircc.html>
